lines.text:
[singing]
Blood and fire, not for me. / Blood and myer, not for me / Lovely ladies, six or seven / Luscious lips, I'm in heaven.
lines.character: Prince Peter Karagin, aka Peter Teranda

lines.text: I don't drink champagne with strangers.
What do you drink with strangers?
lines.character: Prince Peter Karagin, aka Peter Teranda

lines.text: Don't you love someone?
lines.character: Prince Peter Karagin, aka Peter Teranda

lines.text: Is that your business?
I'll pray for him. I'd like to kill him, but I'll pray for him.
lines.character: Prince Peter Karagin, aka Peter Teranda

lines.text: Sorry, I can't afford to meet you again.
Oh what a woman!
lines.character: Prince Peter Karagin, aka Peter Teranda

lines.text: Who and *what* is Masha?
lines.character: Prince Peter Karagin, aka Peter Teranda

lines.text: Ah, I met her last night, your Highness - my eyes met hers, her eyes met mine, our eyes met, and we knew.
Did your Highness say thirty days?
If you insist, I might say sixty.
lines.character: Prince Peter Karagin, aka Peter Teranda

lines.text: Oh, sixty sir! That would kill me sir!
Alright, start dying.
lines.character: Prince Peter Karagin, aka Peter Teranda

lines.text: Don't they put numbers on these houses?
lines.character: Prince Peter Karagin, aka Peter Teranda

lines.text: The new numbers are on brass plates. That's progress. The janitors sell the brass plates for vodka. That's Russia.
Peter! He'll have you jailed!
That's where I sing the best!
lines.character: Prince Peter Karagin, aka Peter Teranda

lines.text: Tomorrow at nine! Eight sixty sharp!
And to think that it took a revolution to bring us together!
I don't exactly know what freedom means, but if it has anything to do with good food, then I'm for it.
